name: Eddie Harris
description: '''Eddie Harris''' (October 20, 1934 â€“ November 5, 1996) was an American [[jazz]] musician, best known for playing [[tenor saxophone]] and for introducing the electrically amplified saxophone. He was also fluent on the [[electric piano]] and organ. His best-known compositions are "Freedom Jazz Dance", popularized by [[Miles Davis]] in 1966, and "Listen Here".
